result.execSummary:
The defendant Jon Randall Wilkinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jon Randall Wilkinson
parties.address: 215 Old Sixth Street,Apt. 443, St. Paul, MN 55102

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
- Sign up for probation.
- 6 days credit against ultimate sentence.

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
- $268 Court Costs. Reduced to a civil judgment.
- $250 DNA Surcharge. Reduced to a civil judgment.

- No contact with Security Financial Bank or Sand Creek, LLC in Bloomer, WI.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- Provide DNA sample.
- Defendant to debrief with law enforcement regarding information about the person who supplied Defendant with checks.
- AODA and follow through with recommendations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jon Randall Wilkinson

defendant.name: Wilkinson, Jon Randall
defendant.address: 215 Old Sixth Street,Apt. 443, St. Paul, MN 55102

records.addlTxt: ec: attys, e: DOC, c: SCSO, DE via mail.  gll
$268 Court Costs, $250 DNA Surcharge, $5 SJF.  gll

10:07 AM AM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, ADA: Erica Ellenwood, DF ATTY: Travis Satorius, DF: Jon Randall Wilkinson appeared from jail.  Set for ARGN.  Parties have reached a resolution, ADA Ellenwood recites joint agreement.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1- Forgery-Uttering in 22CF334.  DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 22CF334. Court waives PSI.  Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders: Ct 1 in 22CF334

S/W 1 Year Probation

- Court Costs: $268.00. 
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $250.00
- Costs be converted to civil judgment

- No Contact with Security Financial Bank and Sand Creek in Bloomer
- Absolute Sobriety 
- AODA and follow through
- Debrief with LEO any information DE can give about the person who supplied DE with checks

- Jail to assist DE with signing up for probation. 

- 6 days credit against ultimate sentence. 

Adjourned at 10:25 AM. bph

08:49 AM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, ADA: Holly Elkin Rockow for ADA: Erica Ellenwood, DF ATTY: Travis Satorius, DF: Jon Randall Wilkinson appeared from jail.  Atty Satorius informed the Court this hearing will be a prelim waiver.  Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Court will schedule arraignment possible plea for today. Adjourned 8:54 AM. bph  Arraignment scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  CT Enterprises of Sand Creek in Bloomer.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, David R.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Security Financial Bank in River Falls.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Pre signed waiver of extradition

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: Liddle ADA:   Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Travis Satorius   DF:  Jon Randall Wilkinson appeared from jail. Address and DOB confirmed. DE has a copy of complaint.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
